body.name: OWC 2.0TB Aura Pro X2 (Gen 4) Complete SSD Upgrade Solution with Tools Envoy Pro Enclosure Compatible with MacBook Air (Mid 2013-2017) and MacBook Pro (Retina, Late 2013 - Mid 2015)
body.stockDetail: Only 10 left in stock - order soon.
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 15 hrs 57 mins
features: Read speeds up to 3335MB/s and Write speeds up to 3271MB/s
Compatible with MacBook Air and MacBook Pro: Works with mid-2013 to mid-2015 MacBook Air and late-2013 to mid-2015 MacBook Pro models.
Easy Installation: Comes with a complete SSD upgrade solution including tools and an OWC Envoy Pro enclosure for seamless installation.
High-Speed Data Transfer: Achieves read speeds of up to 3200MB/s for rapid access to files and applications.
Durable and Portable: Crafted from premium materials for durability and designed to be portable for on-the-go use.
body.description: The OWC Aura Pro X2 provides up to 16x more capacity, and the speed to keep up with your imagination. With that capacity and power, you can keep your Mac running optimally for years — all at a fraction of the cost of buying new. Aura Pro X2 combines speed, stamina, and efficiency that will change the way you experience your Mac. With read speeds reaching 2989MB/s and write speeds of 1208MB/s, Aura Pro X2 is up to 2x faster than the factory Mac SSD, delivering performance on par with the latest Mac models. Calibrated to use less power and run cooler, Aura Pro X2 SSDs are the best way to upgrade your Mac. Your new internal storage upgrade should be a seamless experience. That's why Aura Pro X2 SSD upgrade kits come with a 1TB OWC Express USB portable storage solution. With this solution you get the best of two worlds — a new super fast internal SSD and a new 1TB external drive. Before your upgrade, back up your data to ensure a trouble-free SSD install. After your upgrade, you'll have a spacious, portable drive for data storage or backup purposes. Aura Pro X2 is designed for macOS to take full advantage of the advanced features of APFS (Mac File System) including: strong encryption, copy-on-write metadata, space sharing, cloning for files and directories, snapshots, fast directory sizing, atomic safe-save primitives, and improved file system fundamentals. All that adds up to one heckuva drive that’s built to make your Mac perform at its best.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Super easy! Great quality, awesome how-to videos, I can keep using my 2015 Mac!
reviews.reviewText: If you’re looking to upgrade or just replace your Mac hard drive…buy this! It was so easy and it’s been worth every penny!I love everything about my 2015 Mac…except it came with only a tiny128GB :( This was enough while I was in school, but over time I filled it up rather quickly. I thought I was going to have to upgrade to a newer model, until I found out I could just swap out and upgrade my hard drive! I love that my Mac still has the light up apple logo, and it still works like the day I bought it, so I wasn’t looking to spend $1,000+ to upgrade. Luckily I found this and tried it, and it worked flawlessly!I was a little nervous since I know apple doesn’t play well with 3rd party anything. But the more I researched OWC, the more I saw they were basically as close to OEM as you could get and had fantastic reviews, so I gave it a shot. For 1TB for $120 it seemed too good to be true, but I’m super impressed and super happy with this!Shipping was fast and the ssd was packaged very well. The OWC helps you very easily find your model and associated help videos/guides. The install videos are very clear and super easy to follow, and made changing it out a breeze! They sell toolkits as well, but I only saw this after ordering one from Amazon, but that worked just fine as well for the proprietary screws.The swap was so much easier than I had anticipated, I’ve never done this before and expected apple to block it or be a pain, but no issues! Here’s what I did in case you are doing this upgrade as well:1) Make a Time Machine backup on an external drive2) Make sure your Mac has the newest software updates3) Shut down and swap out your drive4) Power up and hold Command + Option + R while the Apple logo shows. Keep holding until you get prompted for a Wi-if network5) Enter your Wi-if details and follow the prompts6) On the next screen, go to Disk Utility and make sure your new drive shows and is formatted the way you want (I did AFPS)7) Save and return to the previous screen. Next, choose ‘Reinstall Mac OS Monetery’ (or whatever yours shows)8) When it’s done installing the OS, boot up and choose ‘Import from Time Machine Backup’. Select everything you want to bring back9) That’s it! My new drive works perfectly and Time Machine even saved all my downloads and browsers with the windows I had open!Some people said they had to make an external USB drive? I didn’t have to do anything like that, but maybe some newer Macs require it. Mines pretty old (2015) so I’m sure a lot has changed.I also got some awesome speed increases, my write speed increased by almost 80% and my read spread by almost 30%! For $120 to get much better speeds and a normal amount of storage (1TB) which Macs should come with nowadays anyway, I’m more than happy! I wish I would’ve done this long ago, I’ve been deleting things so often just to make room for Mac OS updates due to the tiny drive hahaNext step, my super old batteries have been slowly swelling, time to see if they offer an upgrade there too! Definitely recommend OWC for any apple upgrades!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars GREAT Tech Support
reviews.reviewText: I’m so glad I got this, I’ll get a few more years of use out of my laptop (Macbook Pro 15” retina late 2013). Installed easily, but the disk utility was having trouble locating it. I’m nowhere near any in-person Mac repair, holding a baby, needing my laptop for work, not sure what to do. I saw the phone number on the box and thought, what else am I gonna do? I was totally unprepared to get a REAL person, right away, no long phone queues, who walked me through the issue with ease. Took 10 minutes to resolve the issue and get my new drive on its way. I am so happy I called that number!! Thank you for your help, my new drive is now up and working great. I finally had enough disk space to upgrade my OS and all the software that couldn’t be upgraded until I got the newer OS!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent replacement for Mid-2015 MacBk Pro 15". Tech support helped me with installation
reviews.reviewText: My OEM SSD failed (folder icon with "?") so ordered the OWC 1.0TB Aura Pro X2 for my Mid-2015 MBP 15 Retina. Installation was simple. However, the drive didn't show up initially on Disk Utility. A call to OWC tech support solved the issue.Restart Mac with Comm + Option + R and then format In Disk Utilities, one must "view all volumes" (see photo) to see the drive and then it goes normally. Drive speed is 50% faster than OEM ssd, 2300 Read/ 2700 Write and it's 1TB not the 512mb OEM.Mac boots & runs perceptively faster. This is a great upgrade for $110. It also saved me having to get a newer Mac. Thanks OWC for another great Mac upgrade product! ....I did not get paid for this review btw. just happy to keep my current MBP.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars So far works really well but installation wasn’t without its issues
reviews.reviewText: I bought this to upgrade a 2015 MacBook Air. At first it would not recognize the ssd when I tried to install a fresh os. I took the ssd and put it in an external enclosure (that I already had) put the factory ssd back in the MacBook. Then I booted the MacBook and connected the ssd with the enclosure through usb. It recognized it immediately so I then installed the os to it and powered down the Mac. Next I took the ssd out of the enclosure and installed it into the Mac and it booted up and everything worked well. Little slow and tedious to have to do it like I did but it works so overall I’m happy

Cambiarlo no fue tanto problema, lo que sí me llevó tiempo fue hacer la clonación porque el disco que viene en la caja negra no lo reconocía mi Macbook Pro. Tuve que formatearlo con Utilidad de Disco y hacer la clonación con SuperDuper! del disco de 256GB al de 1TB, fue más rápido con esa aplicación que con Carbon Copy Cloner. Luego de eso, instalé el disco SSD Aura Pro 2X, reinicié e instalé Big Sur, luego fue que pude hacer la clonación del disco copiado a mi nuevo disco.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works better than the original Aura Pro I bought several years ago.
reviews.reviewText: The old Aura drive was failing (after 8 years of continuous and hard use) so bought a newer version as a replacement. Installation was about 5 minutes with the help videos and Apple's online recovery function downloaded the newest compatible Apple OS. This took about 2.5 hours of install time. The next morning, coffee in hand, the system was up and running with a fresh copy of Office 365 in about 20 minutes. I used it for a 4 hour presentation at a client site later that day and it was as if I had bought a new Mac Book Pro.
Fácil instalación, lo reconoció a la primera y buena calidad y velocidad.Recomendado al 100%

Acquistato per sostituire una ssd originale di soli 128GB di un MacBook Air 2015. Montata questa SSD senza nessun problema, operazione molto semplice a patto di avere gli attrezzi giusti e reperibili facilmente.Riconosciuta dal sistema senza problemi, inizializzata e pronta per il sistema operativo, nel mio caso Monterey che ho regolarmente installato (1h.30 minuti). Oltre ad avere ora un archivio di 480 GB mi ritrovo anche le prestazioni migliorate grazie ad una maggior velocità di trasferimento dati (vedi foto DiskSpeedTest) rispetto all'originale.Rapporto qualità/prezzo non proprio idilliaco ma comunque accettabile per mantenere in vita in modo più che dignitoso un Mac già un pò datato. Consigliato. Spedizione fulminea

Die SSD wurde für mein MacBook Air 2015 angeschafft. Der Einbau war dank Anleitung von IFixIt kein Problem. Man muss nur die richtigen Torx zur Hand haben. Wichtig ist, wie in der Anleitung beschrieben, ist das OS Update vom MacBook. Die Karte wurde beim installieren ohne Probleme erkannt und dass Air ist damit fit für ein paar weitere Jahre.
